intro: Epistephium portellianum, commonly known as the Portellian mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of specific host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
